comment: Online course, so I expected a heavy workload. This class is very textbook dependent. There's chapter reviews and listening assignments every week, with 7 tests in total. There's also 3 concert assignments that are super important to pass the class. Despite the class being a little hard, the professor was accessible outside of class and helpful
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Choose anyone else I beg you. Rude teacher. Allot more work than the other music classes. Gen eds shouldn't have 7 test each 75 questions.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Professor Hart isn't a bad professor, but the class itself is a lot of busy work! You have to attend and pay for 3 concerts (which could be fun or boring depending on the concerts you go to). The tests are super long for this course, with each test having 75 questions and the final exam being 100 questions. There's a ton of homework due each week.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Online Savvy

comment: The workload is ridiculous for a simple, required music class. Loads of homework and all exams were roughly 75 questions, and the final exam had too many questions with too little time. Genuinely was my only class with insane workloads, and it's literally music.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Shes absolutely awful 7 test and 70+ questions on each test. for a music elective is excessive. You have to pay for and attend concerts for a grade. questions on the test can have 20+ parts. Over barring and try hard class to be honest. don't take if it's not your major.

This class was easy but there was just a lot of homework and assignments that you had to complete. You also had to attend 3 concerts that can get in the way of your important classes. She would send emails every week to know which assignments to complete which was helpful taking this course online. just a lot of work to complete.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Chill course to meet the fine arts requirement. Some things felt tedious, but overall easy and she was accessible
rating_tags: Lots of homework

comment: This class was very easy—three concerts that you attend of your choice, and they tend to be fun. Class work is manageable and not too bad. Overall, if you need a pre-req filled then take her!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria

comment: Barely saw the teacher, but she was nice ig. A few discussion posts (strong musical vocab use). Lots of connect assignments but very easy, just use online resources... 3 mandatory concert attendances. Please take those pictures before & after. The concerts are $5 each, be prepared to spend money.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Online Savvy

comment: Class is extremely boring, but she is engaging with the students, and very kind. Easy A.
rating_tags: Caring--Online Savvy

comment: You have to attend 3 concerts and do not, DO NOT forget to take before and after pictures. Other than that, her assignments and the final are a breeze.
rating_tags: Caring

comment: Professor Hart is incredible and is very accessible outside of class. She will work with you to be successful. I definitely recommend this course with her. Usually an assigned reading and an easy quiz every week but the material isn't bad at all.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment:
Easy class, perfect for to take online. You can get all of the work done early in the semester and be done, good grade buffer, but you have to go to 2 
KSU concerts and one in ATL. Very sweet lady, wants whats best for everyone, passionate about her profession.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Online Savvy

comment: everything was on connect. every week, a textbook assignment + a review + assigned listenings + sometimes a quiz, discussion, or concert report. very tedious weekly work but not hard. plan ahead for the concert reports that can be for concerts by ASO or KSU as you have to actually attend the concerts & prove attendance in a couple of different ways
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: She's a solid choice, just gotta read the text book and listen to some music. Easy A
incredibe
rating_tags: Hilarious--Caring--Respected

comment: Everything was on connect, which is very easy to use. There are three concerts that have to be attended and write concert reports. Overall, and easy class with a Great professor.

I took Prof Hart online for Music in Society and it consisted of using Connect a lot for lots of assignments. It isn't very hard and requires reading 2 chapters every 2 weeks or by finding answers on Quizlet. 14 chapters, 3 concerts, and 2 other reports are required. Up to 3 extra credit assignments; Prof is accessible, but strict on deadlines.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: This was my first online class and it was so easy. I highly recommend people to take this class online. All of the tests and quizzes are on Quizlet if you need help. There are 3 concert reports due throughout the semester and they took 2 hours to complete. There were also a few discussion posts. She is an easy grader as long as the criteria are met
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: For music 1107 online, this class was very easy. You do all of your work through mcgraw hill online textbook, in which you read the chapter, listen to some music, then take a quiz or test. No lockdown browser or webcam stuff. You have to attend 3 concerts and write an essay on each, but the essays are easy. If you do your work on time, easy A+
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Super easy course. Textbook is on CONNECT. Do the weekly assignments, and you'll make an A. Quizlets are accessible for almost everything :) You do have to attend 3 concerts & write a paper for each: 500 word minimum. It's easy, just have to pay for the ticket. KSU performances are cheap; try to get tickets for on campus shows!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Do yourself a favor and take art or something else this is not an easy A class and she's only making it harder as you go. You're going to need to purchase "Connect" it's like $100 or something. You also have to attend 3 concerts and write a 500 words essay for it. The test + quiz + hw are VERY time consuming and some are difficult too.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: She's so nice and it's super easy, especially if you have been a choir or band student most of your life.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Weekly assignments that consist of quizzes and assigned listenings. Tests every other week. Tests were very specific and quite hard. Required to go to three concerts and write reports on each one. The content itself seemed to get very difficult at some points.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I am an engineering major and got a easy A in this class. I enjoyed Professor Hart and didnt think the class was boring at all. Shes super nice and grades very leniently. Show up to class, do short weekly assignments and youll do fine on the online quizzes which are the questions for the midterm and final. 2 required performances to attend.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT--Caring

comment: Professor Hart is very boring, but this was the easiest class I have ever taken. There are online quizzes over power points from class and can be taken until you get a 100. The final and midterm questions are all from quizzes. There are 2 concerts you must attend, a KSU concert and an Atlanta Symphony Orchestra concert. DON'T BUY THE BOOK!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Dont buy the book. This is an easy class. She doesnt give difficult assignments. If youre looking to just fill this credit because its required this is the way to go

Her class is easy as long as you show up, but the thing about showing up is that her class is unbearably boring, and not one thing she says will end up on a test or a quiz. Everything will need to be learned outside of class on your own. She takes off 1% of your final grade for every single absence so If you have trouble with attendance, stay away!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Easy class. Show up take notes and you will get an A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I recommend buying/renting the book, for the assignments and the tests. Make sure you get the two required concerts done early in the semester. The professor cares about her students, and she is patient if you are struggling with a concept she will reword it until you understand.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Hart is great.  Her lectures are easy to understand and she clearly covers what is needed for the exams.  The chapters in the text book are only a few pages.  If you spend 15-30 mins a day keeping up with the text book and lecture, you will get an A.  Extra credit is offered, but in my opinion should not be needed.  I learned alot in this class
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Attendance is mandatory and class is pretty boring but its easy. Tests/quizzes are straight from the powerpoints on D2L. Group project is easy also.

Dr hart is an awesome professor if you're planning to take music class. Attendance does matters for overall grading. Easy quizzes + Exams. All the lecture Notes Are uploaded on D2l as PowerPoint. Gives study guide in each exam. Easy to get an A.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures--Clear grading criteria

comment: Overall this is an easy class. She makes you actively participate in groups so if you're not social like me, you won't really like her class. She pretty friendly. Only thing I didn't really care for was the fact that you have to attend a mandatory KSU performance and go to a professional opera or orchestra.
rating_tags: Participation matters

comment: She is nice. Honestly not that hard. Lectures are online and test and quizzes come straight from it. Group project is not that hard, simple and easy. If I had to take the course again I'd take her.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: If you're looking for an easy A,  take this class. I feel every second tick by that I'm in class. She lectures directly off the power point, nothing new or exciting. She is not very helpful and her group project sucks. Let me put it this way, her class has mandatory attendance, and only 22/60 people come on a good day. Take it on Kennesaw  campus.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS
